website_summaries.verdict: A cleverly designed lightweight laptop stand that works with a wide variety of laptops and is priced for any budget.
pros: AmazonBasics laptop stand is made of a fine-gauge metal mesh that allows air to circulate around the laptop, which may help extend the laptop's life
The unit has 7 height adjustment settings and features a cord organizer to help keep your work area neat
cons: The stand functions best when you use a separate keyboard and mouse to type and navigate

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw for those who intend to do a lot of typing.
customer_reviews.text: The stoppers to keep the laptop from sliding, are too tall and they are right where my wrists naturally lay when typing. I bought this mainly for writing, so that is a deal breaker. They are intrusive, just search the word wrists on this product and you will see that others have the problem as well. In my case my lap top is think, I think that putting foam on them will make it even more uncomfortable. I have smaller thin hands, and can fit in between the stoppers, but it feels really cramped.
customer_reviews.author: Hexanna

customer_reviews.title: Hurts your hands, doesn't function properly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. I use a Chromebook, and the metal stoppers that hold the laptop in place on the front are exactly where my hands need to be for ergonomic typing. So either they dig into my wrists, or I told my hands artificially high. I guess if you had a really thick laptop this could work...but who has a really thick laptop anymore? And the cord organizer wouldn't clip onto the back properly. Waste of money, glad I got a refund
customer_reviews.author: K. Croto

customer_reviews.title: ... you have children or if you have fingers and like them. It will close on your fingers and ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this if you have children or if you have fingers and like them. It will close on your fingers and that frame stronger than any finger. And a child would never get it off. Cuts right to the bone.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great with an easy modification.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed to allow ventilation/heat dissipation, good options for viewing angle. One flaw that could kill it for you, the braces that keep the laptop from slipping off are quite high and, without modification, will, unless you have a quite thick laptop, hit your wrists quite uncomfortably. My solution was to add two caster cups one at each side at the bottom of the unit (an easy search here on Amazon) held on with double sided tape. With this modification (I already had them), it's fine. Without adding the cups, I could not use it. Three stars since a modification is needed. I've attached a picture which seems to be upside down, but you get the idea...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product is very poor. The design allows for the two small projections ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is very poor. The design allows for the two small projections on the bottom to ram into your wrists, they are to high and very painful. This product is headed for the trash can. For so many products amazon is very good they are the best. But this one is a big lemon. I would attest a return how I tried to bed the holder back, so by altering the product i doubt it is returnable. I undersnt this. Amazon please take this off you choice list. Thank you.. J
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fundamental design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because of a fundamental design flaw: the tabs that hold the laptop at the bottom are too high and placed exactly where my wrists want to rest. The result is that the stand is unusable. Don't waste your time and look for a better designed one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: VERY uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I returned the item. It's a great in it's mesh design and adjustable height. However you need to place your wrists on the very uncomfortable metal pieces in order to use your laptop. If they made the tabs only tall enough to hold the laptop on the stand, I would have kept it. But they stick way up, and you must rest your wrists on top.
customer_reviews.author: the puzzler

customer_reviews.title: Stoppers are Awful
customer_reviews.text: Darn! I had so much hope for this, as I have been searching for a reasonably priced laptop riser. This would be a perfect product if the stoppers designed to keep the laptop on the tray were adjustable. They are too big and place right where your wrists should go. Unfortunately, there is no way to adjust the height of the stoppers to be flush with the thickness of the laptop, so they just get in the way. I will be sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: WorkPartners

customer_reviews.title: What's up with the wrist metal rests? or what are the called?
customer_reviews.text: What's up with the wrist metal rests? or what are the called? I was so thrilled when I got it in position and put laptop up on it. Wow, I thought this was perfect, until I tried using my laptop. What in the world is the big high hard and sharp metal wrist rests for? Are they wrist rests? It is very difficult to use without wrists sitting on these, or sides of wrists getting hit by them. this would be the perfect holder if I could find something very soft, I am looking for like a gel filled something to place over so I can use. Until I find that, I cannot use. disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand, great price, can live with the few, minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: What I Like: It does exactly what it says it does. Great price. Has 8 notches for holding laptop in a wider degree of angles than most other ventilated stands. Has channeled cable holder on the back to keep cables for peripherals handy and organized. What I Don't Like: A little clunky looking. The stops at the bottom that keep the laptop from sliding off have curved notches on top, presumably for resting wrists in, but they are hardly comfortable. I put foam pads there when using the stand which helps.
customer_reviews.author: Curious EpicureTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Bars to keep laptop on the stand too high - dug into wrists
customer_reviews.text: I have a new Macbook Pro which is very thin. The bars to keep the laptop on the stand were too high. They dug into my wrists. I returned this item
customer_reviews.author: Jancyskid

customer_reviews.title: Basically Unusable
customer_reviews.text: The metal tabs that hold the laptop in place are far too tall and are placed exactly where your wrists need to rest in order to type. Unless you have a large, boxy laptop, I can't imagine this being comfortable to use. I had planned to use this for my work computer. As a programmer, I'm typing on the keyboard all day - not having bits of metal jabbing into my wrists is pretty important to me. Definitely returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Big ergonomic flaw
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this stand, and there's an immediate issue that would've stopped me from purchasing this. The wrist rests. The metal pieces that prop up the laptop on the stand are shaped so that you can rest your wrists on them when typing. However, you cannot move them left or right, meaning that depending on how you type, they end up digging into your wrists uncomfortably. While they aren't sharp, they are thin enough that I could imagine my circulation getting cut off on long typing sessions. Otherwise, the construction is fine, but a supplementary product that hinders the use of the main product (aka the laptop) is a failure in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Metal holders get in the way
customer_reviews.text: Agreed with everyone else. The stand is great, allows for maximum airflow and raises the screen to eye height. And you have to use an external keyboard because you can't type on the laptop because of the metal stoppers. No laptop is that thick anymore. 1/2" would have been enough to keep the laptop from sliding off, but still allow typing on the laptop. Too many people having to add spacers under the laptop, which removed any ergonomic advantage by causing pain in the wrist rather than the neck. I'm going to saw off and file down the excess.
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Great except for 2 design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I used to just use a foldable riser for my laptop but it didn’t allow enough circulation. This is a great stand except for two slight design flaws. First the stoppers at the bottom are too high and are placed just in the right place to hit your wrists. Second flaw is there’s nothing to keep the laptop from sliding around on the metal. I ended up using 2 flat rubber bumpers that I have for the back of picture frames. So suggestions to the designers, make the stoppers movable or at least shorter and add a few pieces of rubber near the top to minimize sliding of the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: good idea and price but not for me
customer_reviews.text: was not for me, could feel the metal that makes up the stand heating up, so tempt cooling was not nearly strong or efficient enough for my heavy programing use, might be good for those not needing actual cooling, recently got a version with usb fans it's been above and beyond so far, good idea functions well but the material should not be metal since the laptop is shelled it's not a giant heat sink the stand just increases once you reach a certain point, needs work/adjustment for the nerdy IT crowd to get behind, id state the possible ways to make this stand soo superior but not sure it would make a difference, much<3
customer_reviews.author: burn1

customer_reviews.title: Not for typing
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to get a sense of it from the pictures, but the metal tabs that keep the laptop from sliding off the front ... they're huge. On a 2015 13" MacBook, those tabs dug painfully into my wrists when I tried to type while using this stand. They're too sturdy to bend to a more reasonable position - I broke the hinges when I tried. If you're looking for a stand you can type with ... look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aayore

customer_reviews.title: OK for raising the display height but not good for typing.
customer_reviews.text: The "ears" that hold the bottom of the laptop are too tall/high. The "ears" extend way above any normal laptop and hit your hands/wrist when you type. The "ears" prevent you from resting your hands when typing. Works good to to raise the height of the display but if you want to do any typing you will need a remote keyboard. A poor design that could easily be fixed by shortening the height of the "ears" so they don't extend way above the height of the average laptop.
customer_reviews.author: motorhead

customer_reviews.title: Painful to use.
customer_reviews.text: There are two metal stoppers at the base that are intended to stop the laptop from sliding off the wire mesh. Those two metal stoppers are exactly where my wrists go when I type. It is a total deal breaker, and quite uncomfortable. Painful at times. Honestly, I don't understand how this has such a high review from so many people. It will be great for people who aren't doing a lot of typing, but if you are don't buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher 83

customer_reviews.title: handy little device
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laptop stand because I was working from home for a while, and using the laptop on my home desk was killing my neck and shoulders. This stand holds the laptop in an ergonomic position for extended reading. It adjusts to several positions, and it has little gripper pads to keep the laptop in place. There are also gripper pads to keep the stand in place on the desk surface. It appears to be sturdy for normal expected use. The little cord keeper that you attach to the back is handy as well. All in all, please with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy W

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: No zero star rating as an option. There are two metal pieces that stick 1" above the frame of the desk stand. So, your arms rest on theses as you type. Horrible design. I should return it but will have the pieces cut off or at least cut below the level of the laptop keyboard. Truly - STAY AWAY! How this got past R&D is beyond me!
customer_reviews.author: Abby J Feldman

customer_reviews.title: A Gift for my Aunt
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Aunt who likes to sit in a chair with her laptop on her lap and her legs would get warm and sometimes hot because of the heat that comes from the laptop. Since she has gotten this she says she loves it. She actually uses it on her lap with her laptop and it gives ventilation to her laptop and brings her laptop more to eye level rather than her having to look down at it. It is sturdy and well built and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Lee

customer_reviews.title: I even travel with this now!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift when my new position was work from home. I basically didn't use it properly for the first 6 months, i just used it for computer ventilation (which it helped with) but then I readjusted it so it put the screen at eye level, and not I have it sitting on a shoe box to it's at the perfect height and I love it (I have a usb keyboard and mouse.) It travels in my laptop bag snugly. It's not tiny, but I fit it in and slide my charger cord and mouse between it so it acts like a protector. Happy with it, wouldn't give it up now I have my office set up! haha
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: LOVE - we now own 3!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most basic, clunky but practical and brilliant computer racks. they are sturdy and durable, and give me peace of mind about the radiation from laptops my kids are using. Highly recommend as a mom of 3. I bought my first one about a year ago and with quarantine, we needed more and each kid now has one. Makes doing school in bed much easier! hahaha. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsbojangles

customer_reviews.title: Could Have Been So Much Better
customer_reviews.text: The metal mesh design offers great air ventilation, and the tilt design will last a long long time. My experience with AmazonBasics is that the products are well built at a good price and this is no exception. However, the front stoppers are too tall, they jab into my wrists while typing. I bent them all the way forward to get them out of the way and it is better. I plan on cutting them down a bit my dermal when I get a chance so they do not extend above my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Check properly before you send it to customers
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for laptop and I used it the day it got delivered. I was so disappointed cuz my laptop was not sitting properly and it's wiggling up and down. I was so happy when it came but so mad after.
customer_reviews.author: Victorino Paat Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need for COVID desk!
customer_reviews.text: My wife had a nice little laptop stand, that we shared as normally we didn't work at home together often, but when COVID hit and we are all home working, I needed something for my machine. Picked this up after reading the reviews. It serves my purpose perfectly. It is a laptop stand, you shouldn't have to move it around often, so it should last a long time when treated properly. If you dropped it on the floor I think the metal frame might get bent, but you should be able to bend it right back into place. It was slightly out of whack when it arrived, but a few bending tweaks and it was sitting fine on my workspace.
customer_reviews.author: Mt Tom Photo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Artist
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my watercolor block paper while I paint. It is low enough to keep the paint and water from dripping all down the paper and high enough to prevent neck/shoulder pain from being hunched over a project laying flat on the table. Adjustable heights make it easy to work on multimedia pieces, switching from paint to pencil to pastel sticks without any hassle. It is also very light weight and would be good for traveling as long as you have a small flat surface to use it such as a bench, picnic table, small folding table, etc. I would not suggest placing it on your lap to paint.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mehler

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get if you want to type on your laptop, for keyboard use only.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a stand to hold your laptop while you use a keyboard at home, this is great. If you want to type on the laptop itself, it is terrible because the two metal tabs that support the laptop are tall and positioned right where your wrists sit - uncomfortable and likely to cause repetitive motion injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Torture device
customer_reviews.text: Would be great if only I could remove the wrist torture devices on the front of the tray. It's horrible because of the two stupid big sharp steel protrusions right on the front of the thing.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGill

customer_reviews.title: Usable, not ideal
customer_reviews.text: Although this laptop stand is usable, I think it is badly designed and poorly put together. The MINIMUM height of the back of the laptop stand is about 5 inches, which is too steep an angle for the laptop to sit on for many people. If you wanted something just moderately tilted, this isn't it. The foam "feet" on the bottom are glued on haphazardly in no particular position, like someone just didn't care where they went. There is no printed material like instructions included with the stand. It is acceptable, but poor.
customer_reviews.author: L. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great product for home office with a laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help my posture at my 15" laptop. I was tired of hunching over my screen, which sits lower on my desk causing me to always look down and slouch. It's nice office-grade metal work and comes with an adjustable bar. It will also sit snuggly on the back 2" shelf just fine, which give me my perfect angle. I can also store a notebook inside so that my desk looks less cluttered when done. Mesh design is both sturdy yet let's the hot air escape my computer so it stays cooler longer. I'd recommend this to anyone with a lower-set desk and a long back and who struggles with back, neck and muscle pain at your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: TigerWyngz

customer_reviews.title: Showed up bent out of shape
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this is good, but the product showed up bent out of shape so it doesn't lay flat. You can still use it, but it's just enough to be very annoying to me, and RL has been so busy these recent months, I haven't actually been home to use it too much or in order to exchange it, but yeah, will need to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Tenoko1

customer_reviews.title: what's terrific there is the ability to change the angle based ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this for music equipment. I own (4) of these now, (2) are being used to support (2) Roland MX-1s, I have (1) used to support my Novation Peak, what's terrific there is the ability to change the angle based on if I am working with it or not, and then my last one is currently used on my Ableton Push to improve the viewing angle. I am a heavy finger drummer and it has provided terrific support, without making any additional noise when struck.
customer_reviews.author: Unreallystic

customer_reviews.title: Stability is an issue
customer_reviews.text: This product is great in concept, as it could really save your back / neck during the work day. Unfortunately, the bottom edge was bent on the one I received, which caused the entire stand to wobble. Ordered a replacement and had the same issue. Seems like a quality control rather than a design issue, but either way I returned both and will opt for a product less likely to suffer from instability.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: laptop stand
customer_reviews.text: This style did not work for my needs. I rated according to that. It tilted the laptop forward too much even on the lowest setting. It was not comfortable to use the laptop while sitting on this stand.
customer_reviews.author: sheila

customer_reviews.title: The perfect desk laptop stand ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm always slouching or bending over the table trying to get my sight of vision just right for the laptop screen -- NO MORE! Also getting the keyboard just right so I can type without hitting the wrong key was a challenge, and I know how to type quite accurately! NO MORE. The stand is well made, sturdy and easy to adjust. Having the stand ventilated is a plus. Although there are pads under the stand I went ahead and put a cloth place mat under it to ensure there would be no scratching of my wood table. This makes it convenient to slide the whole thing out of the way if need be. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for wrists
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdiness and adjustability of this stand. I can put the computer at a good angle while allowing air flow underneath to cool it without needing an external fan. However, the plastic pieces that stick up to keep the computer from sliding off impede wrist comfort. To type comfortably, one must put a shim under the front of the computer to raise it above the level of these plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: P. Harding

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop stand. It is light weight and sleek so it doesn't take up a lot of space on my desk. It's a perfect set up if you already have an external keyboard and mouse. I have mine set up on the tallest placement for my camera to be at eye level when I'm seated at my desk. I like that it is breathable. My docking station can remain attached to the laptop and it still sits on the stand just fine without wobbling and there are slots behind it for cords. It's easy to move from room to room if I wanted to move with me. Excellent bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: Almost great laptop stand...almost
customer_reviews.text: This laptop stand is excellent...but...the bottom retention tabs that keep the laptop on the stand extend OVER THE HEIGHT OF THE KEYBOARD...meaning that as you try to type these tabs are sticking you in the wrists!!! WTF? Who designed this otherwise excellent & versatile product? The bottom tabs should be adjustable or shorter so that they don't extend past the keyboard surface!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bullwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Good basic desktop laptop stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a good basic desktop laptop stand. Helps elevate a laptop of a desk in order to help with cooling. Just like many of the reviews, the end stops are a bit high, but not a deal breaker. This stand is made of thin wire mesh which will support a 15 inch laptop, but bends easy if your not careful. Also don't care for the amazon branding tag on the stand. Would be nice if this stand did not have any name on it. The bottom line if your using this on a desk it works perfect. However not good for travel or sitting in your lap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Designed badly.
customer_reviews.text: This is designed badly, the bumper to keep the computer from sliding off are to high and are right where your wrist need to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kayden Mc Farland

customer_reviews.title: metal ledge goes into your wrists
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed so that the metal will cut off the circulation in your wrists. I’m going to try to return but I got rid of all the boxing. Hope that’s not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Caused wifi interference
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of this product due to its simplicity and functionality. The cable organizer on the back is a great idea. HOWEVER, this laptop stand interferes with the wifi signal on my 2014 MacBook Pro. I noticed a significant decrease in speed and an increase in latency. I also noticed that I had an issue with my Bluetooth but I'm not 100% certain of it. I did however, test the WiFi multiple times with and without the stand to verify my suspicion about the interference. If it doesn't interfere with your laptop it's great for the price. It just simply didn't work for my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P.

customer_reviews.title: I know it's best to be used with an aux keyboard, but....
customer_reviews.text: It works great overall, and really helps to elevate the laptop into a better position. However, I wish it came with a wrist pad for the metal arms where the bottom of the laptop sits - at a slight incline it's actually a comfortable/ergonomic position to type!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Great Ergonomic Stand for Two-In-One Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Don't search anymore for the BEST ERGONOMIC STAND! You have found it! I received it yesterday and I love it - I can't get off the computer! I didn't add the Cord Organizer...it is optional. As you can see from my pics it is not necessary as my cords are on the left side of the two-in-one laptop. It fits absolutely perfect. I have a Lenovo C930 and it is a 14" keyboard and monitor. I went with the basic stand and did not elevate it but I could have if I so chose that option. Very easy to change the height and angle of the keyboard and monitor. Thank you Amazon love love this ventilated stand!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Royse

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you plan on typing with the laptop on the stand
customer_reviews.text: The two metal tabs that keeps the laptop from sliding downwards will damage your wrist. There is absolutely no reason for them to be so tall, but I didn't realise this when I brought it. Now it's just a piece of junk. I might as well just put it on an elevated stand if I have to plug in a keyboard and mouse etc... in order to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stand and has built in cable management
customer_reviews.text: I have two MacBook pros, and one of these for each. Heat dissipation is great, I really like how you can adjust the height and angle, and the built in rubber cord manager thing is super handy for use with a docking station or multiple hubs. I have tried the more expensive aluminium frame stands and they aren’t any better than this, and many are less adjustable, and even fewer have built in cord management. You won’t be disappointed with this. In fact, with most larger laptops, you probably won’t even see it often.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: I like this item - BUT BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware - the metal “holders” on the front that keep the laptop from sliding forward are tall and will dig into your wrists when you type on the keyboard. When my ASUS is open these stick up more than 1/4 inch. I really wanted this to work so I can see the keyboard better so I attached a 1/4 inch piece of board between the laptop & the platform which raises it above the metal holders. It is good now but beware of this design issue.
customer_reviews.author: baydogs

customer_reviews.title: You Get Multiple Lift Options!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted something to lift my laptop at work, so I can stop craning my neck downwards. Along with continuing to be able to access the keyboard. This hits the nail on the head with extra features for a reasonable price! The cord organizer on the back is the only "assembly required" part, and the stand has adjustable heights for differing needs. The ventilation was not a feature I was overly concerned about, but my laptop is now quieter. DOUBLE BONUS! All in all, AmazonBasics for the win, again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: helps reduce neck strain!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Bought one for myself and am really pleased with it at the lowest setting. It brought the monitor up to eye level which really helped with the neck strain. Plus, the monitor used to cast shadows on the keyboard making it difficult to read but this stand tilts the keyboard slightly and alleviates the shadowing. I like it so well that my husband decided to try it. He fell in love with it and wouldn't give it back so I had to buy another one! We both use a little strip of cardboard under the keyboard to raise it enough that our wrists aren't sitting on the tabs that keep the keyboard from slipping off the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Laptops Used in a Desktop Setting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this raise my laptop screen to be at the same height as my 27" monitor. The laptop is connected to a USB dock with a keyboard, mouse, and monitor. If you want to use this as an ergonomic laptop stand, then I think you'll be just as disappointed as the others regarding the placement and height of the plastic stops at the bottom of the stand. If you're looking for an adjustable stand to raise your laptop for a more ergonomic desk environment, then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Sits too high off the desk (if you're short)
customer_reviews.text: The laptop stand holds my 17" HP just fine. However it raises the whole laptop off the desk 1.5" before you add the pitch to it. I'm 5'3" and that made this too high for me to comfortably reach. Perhaps if I didn't have a pencil drawer so I could raise my chair higher I might have been able to make it work but the stress on my shoulders caused by trying to reach the keyboard isn't worth it. I have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: SLW

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy another stand
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this laptop stand for a little over one month & love it! I am so glad I didn't spend more money on the numerous stands out there. I was worried it may not hold my 17 inch Dell Inspiron, but is doing so nicely. It is not wobbly at all. It has great skid resistant pieces on the bottom too. At its lowest level, it provides great stability and is easy to type. I can store my 2 external hard drives underneath with its nice cord holder to clip the cords on. Spray paint it another color if you want color but don't spend more money!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Laptop Cool and the Keyboard More Accessible
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a new laptop - the previous laptop just had a cooling fan pad under it that kept it a little higher at the back. Which made it easier to see the keys. The new laptop has silver keys, much more difficult to see the letters. So not only does this mesh stand keep the bottom of the laptop from being on a solid surface (lets it cool much better off the table) but the tilt lets me see the keys better. VERY pleased with it. Well made and sturdy. And big enough to use with a 17" laptop!
customer_reviews.author: cindy440

customer_reviews.title: Very good with one major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This provides exactly what I was looking for; plenty of ventilation, sturdy, lightweight, and has the ability to adjust to numerous angles. But, as other reviewers have commented, the front stops that hold the laptop in place are much taller than necessary, and are in the exact positions that interfere with hand placement, uncomfortably hitting both wrists. I plan to grind them down and put padding on them, but the company could easily accomplish the same with small stops.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: It feels kind of cheap, but that's probably because it is cheap. The cable management system that hooks onto the back of ours was difficult to install and never really fit quite right. At least it's hidden in the back. My wife likes having this for her home office setup more than she thought she would. It's nice if you have a second monitor and want to raise the laptop screen up higher so that you're not looking up and down all day when switching between screens. I would recommend using this with an external keyboard and mouse. The ergonomics would not be good if you tried to use the laptop keyboard and trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: MrMarcel

customer_reviews.title: Finally a laptop stand that works!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different wire stand and my laptop kept slipping off the stand if I put it on the highest setting. Which I needed due to I have an old laptop and it gets hot very fast. Twice I smashed my fingers in the old one. So, I decided to try this laptop stand. Oh my Gosh! I am SO glad I decided to buy it!! The casing and brackets keeps it from falling and the high braces have foam on them and keep the laptop in place. Very user friendly!! Hasn't slipped once.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dectres

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This is horrible. The edges are too high and sharp. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DrV

customer_reviews.title: Laptop stand is fine. It's the delivery...
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a place where we could give feedback about the delivery. When I checked the status of my orders, this particular delivery was marked "delivered directly to a resident," which is not true. The package was left on my doorstep. Does my doorstep count as a "resident?" I guess i should be happy it was still there when I got home. The laptop stand itself is fine. Made of metal. Very sturdy. I don't have the problem with the tabs sticking up too high that others speak of because I use it backwards for ergonomic reasons (the keyboard is tilted down away from me). Laptop no longer feels hot when using on my lap.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not for typing, otherwise pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this I thought it was great. Great as opposed to looking down all the time. It is terrible for typing though. It isn't stable so if you put any weight/slight force on it while typing it will rock a little and squeak. Eventually I got fed up with the squeaking and found a better laptop stand. If you want this stand and don't intend to type with it, it's a great little stand. If you intend to use the laptop keyboard, It might be annoying to you.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Almost Paradise
customer_reviews.text: This is almost perfect. First was so wobbly due to uneven base that I ordered a replacement. The second was worse than the first! Luckily the weight of the laptop keeps it pretty stable. Also, the solid part of the mesh completely covered the vent I was trying to keep ventilated. I figured a way to prop the laptop up about an inch with plastic cubes which cleared the vent area. Adjustability is good but there were obstacles to overcome. This will also be a good adjustable base for my iPad in the horizontal position.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for value, however, uncomfortable for typing
customer_reviews.text: I love that it’s metal and that wire material so your laptop can breathe. It also has a great range of options for the height. However my only complaint is that the two clips at the bottom that work as a ledge so the laptop doesn’t slide down are very uncomfortable for typing. They stick up quite high and sit right where your hands sit. So if you use your computer more for mouse use, I definitely recommend for the value. I just wish the ledge wasn’t so high or it went straight across.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Wrich

customer_reviews.title: It's a great laptop stand that does everything a fixed stand should do.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I've had the product for two years and it works perfectly for my use case. It elevates the laptop stand to align with my monitors. It's a perfect solution. The build quality of the materials feel great and the laptop is sturdy. I don't type on the laptop when it is in use so I can't comment on the functionality of using the laptop for typing. The laptop feels like the airflow is good since the stand is of a chainlink texture. I purchased on for home and another for work.
customer_reviews.author: hashrate

customer_reviews.title: Poor design but there is a way around it.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest issue I have is in the overall design. There are two metal, at wrist level, that are suppose to keep your lap top from sliding off the mesh top. They are positioned exactly where your wrists should be when typing. Realizing this was going to be extremely uncomfortable, I decided to turn the lap top hold upside down. The metal lap top holders hand over the edge of my desk, which keep it from sliding while I'm typing. And they are out of the way when typing. I then thought I was wrong from the beginning and had it set up incorrectly, however that wasn't the case. So, all in all, poor designed but made well.
customer_reviews.author: Rosey

customer_reviews.title: Does a job
customer_reviews.text: I am a Karaoke Host and use two of these, one for my laptop and one for a small Mackie Profx8 mixer and it does the job I need it to do. The wire mesh is a little flimsy and after first use had obvious indentions from where the mixer and laptop sit on them. However, this doesn't affect the performance of the item. I'm not really a fan of the wire guide placement since most laptops have ports on the sides and not the back of the laptop. Overall it works well
customer_reviews.author: Shotgun&Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and took the impact of me accidentally dropping it a couple times. Puts my laptop on an angle and raises it slightly so I can get it to eye level with my desk at work. If there is one critique (and this doesn’t remove any stars since you can see it in the picture) it would be that the small lips that hold the laptop on the stand can stick up slightly. (But again you can see it in the picture and my laptop was big enough that this didn’t cause any discomfort where I rested my hands). I could only see this as an issue with ultra thin laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Will give you carpel tunnel syndrome
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this stand, and you will too solely based on the fact that unless you have an abnormally think laptop (like some of the earliest ones ever invented), you're forced to rest your wrists on the black tabs shown in the pics, which are actually modern-day torture devices. No joke in that they tell you to prop your laptop up with cardboard pieces that they either include or you have to fashion from the box it comes in, which is ridiculous. Avoid this product unless you enjoy things that may give you carpel tunnel syndrome.
customer_reviews.author: therudder1

customer_reviews.title: Very handy; design is good
customer_reviews.text: I just got this delivered and had to try it out and it's working great. I hated the flat keyboard and with my new laptop I kept hitting unexpected keys which was very annoying. Now I'm typing happily with the stand. I did take the suggestion of another reviewer who suggested using some of the packing material to raise the lower part so that the grabbers don't get in the way. You can't go wrong with this because it does what it's supposed to do and the price is definitely right. Thanks, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: It does what I need it to but it's incredibly uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: There are these two arms to hold your laptop and the way they're positioned they actively interfere with my ability to use my in keyboard mouse pad, and left and right-click. they also jam into my wrists and hurt. Perhaps maybe if my laptop was smaller, I don't know. So due to this, I have to perch my laptop on TOP of the laptop hold supports. It;s also extremely easy to pinch yourself in between the two pieces picking this up. It will do but I am def going to research and pick a better quality item payday.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Moss

customer_reviews.title: Simple mod fix
customer_reviews.text: Like most reviewers have stated, the "stoppers" that keep the laptop from sliding down towards you stick *way* too high up, pressing on your wrists. But, in about fifteen minutes I cut them down to half their size and smoothed them out with a pair of tin snips and a file (no before photo shown, there's plenty on the other reviews). So if you're willing to do a somewhat simple modification, this is worth twenty bucks. P.S. I wouldn't trust this on the highest angle, but I wouldn't trust my wrists at that angle either.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Those tabs at the bottom poke my wrists!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, simple, inexpensive. But like many other reviewers, I've found that the tabs that hold the bottom front edge of the laptop poke up right at my wrists. I took some pliers and bent the tabs back, which helps a lot, but requires that I slide my laptop under the tabs to get it in and out of the stand, a minor nuisance, and they are still somewhat in the way. This manufacturer should offer a variety of tab heights, or just make them a quarter inch rather than a full inch high.
customer_reviews.author: John Vidale

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop Desk Stand!
customer_reviews.text: The AmazonBasics Ventilated Adjustable Laptop Computer Holder Desk Stand is exactly as described. I recently purchased a high-end HP laptop and know it should be ventilated...it is warm in sunny Southern California. This stand is perfect. The mesh allows ample airflow, even for my laptop that measures slightly more than 14 inches across. The laptop overlaps slightly on both sides, but is very stable and looks fine. I recommend the stand.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Functional and practical for price
customer_reviews.text: This laptop stand was the most reasonably priced for quality, size, durability, and angle dimensions. I like that it is somewhat portable as well. My older 16" laptop fits perfect. My newer 17" screen laptop is thinner and the two bars at the bottom that holds it in place extends above the laptop thickness. With some adjustments (using cut styrofoam) I was able to make it comfortable for my wrists (a complaint from many low rating buyers). I bought this stand to improve my posture while working at the desk which has previously caused recurring neck issues. I found it to help these issues.
customer_reviews.author: JPag

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great choice for those needing a budget laptop stand. I am using this with a 15" MacBook Pro Retina and it is very sturdy. There are two feet at the bottom with a soft material that'll keep the laptop in place. The stand itself has a lot of height levels that'll satisfy most users. In the back, amazon includes a grommet that is used to route cables to make your setup more neat. The only thing I changed/added was two soft pads (felt stickers would work too) to each side of the stand that the laptop makes contact with to prevent any scratches from metal on metal. Other than that, this is worth your hard earned money.
customer_reviews.author: Bong Sun

customer_reviews.title: I do enjoy using this item but its mainly for laptops and ...
customer_reviews.text: They almost hit a home run here but a few minor changes would help. I do enjoy using this item but its mainly for laptops and large ipads. I have a small ipad and when vertical it falls through the two metal book tabs serving as holders. One more met tab would be perfect. I also would have like one or two more opening extensions to elevate the reading plate. Very well constructed, decent weight, very durable as I had dropped twice and nothing was damaged, comfortable when using, one great feature as the back allows for air flow. All in all it works for me especially perfect with the laptop which is designed for.
customer_reviews.author: sitebum

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stylish, this is a stand you should take.
customer_reviews.text: If you can see the photos in the product description, you know what you're getting. I like how sturdy this is, it is quality manufacture and it does everything you expect it to. The design also is good at putting the screen closer to a comfortable viewing height than just plopping it on a cooling pad or lap. When I opened the package, my wife said "Oh, a lot of people I work with use those". Knowing where she works, that says a lot about how this stand does what it's intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon Basics Ventilated Adjustable Laptop Computer Holder Desk Stand is sturdy, stable and relatively ergonomically good. That being said, there is no way to make it flat unless you prop the edge of the laptop on the curved stops that keep the laptop from falling off. When you it put on the stand normally the curves of the stops will irritate your wrists. At least that is my experience. Other than that, it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: TIA CHERY

customer_reviews.title: The Best Laptop stand ?
customer_reviews.text: The Best laptop stand ?? I use 2 laptops and always have both on a stand. Not just about airflow. Off the desk to avoid liquid spills. Tilt of the keyboard is necessary, IMO. Doubt I could type without it. This is my 5th stand. The others had one weak point in common: flimsy. This one is indeed sturdy. Does not slide - a good thing. Many angles of adjustment to chose from. I teach classes part-time and need portability. Too bad this one does not fold flat. But it does not weigh too much. And I believe it is the right size for most any laptop. Gene
customer_reviews.author: Gene A. Staver

customer_reviews.title: 2 Thumbs up! A WINNER!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this portable ventilated laptop desk/riser. It's affordable, mostly comfortable and EASY to transport and lightweight. The only thing I agree upon that many have mentioned are that the two ROUNDED (good) stops that keep your laptop from slipping off do sometimes dig into the wrists and forearms if/when you rest upon them. It's a little inconvenience and could probably be 100% solved with a little pad stuck or glued on. That said the 'stops' have a dip for your arm to fit in if you place your arm 'correctly'! HIGHLY RECOMMEND this great little lap desk. Keeps my lap from getting hot, my laptop from overheating and my eyes and neck/spine neutral. A WINNER! :)
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Works well after this fix to make your wrists comfortable typing.
customer_reviews.text: I mostly love it..I love the angle variations you can chose. I love that my computer isn't getting hot. What I don't love is that the placement of the upright metal pieces that the computer rests on are super uncomfortable for your wrists. The fix is to take the piece of rubber they supply for holding your power cord and instead, place it right in front of either one of those upright pieces of metal that torture your wrists. Then let your laptop rest on top of it and you are good to type away comfortably again.
customer_reviews.author: JAK

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea!!!  Second purchase for me!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these a few years ago for my laptop and loved it! My lap top is going on 10 yrs old, and I believe that using this product has prolonged its life. The lap top was always shutting off without warning because it would get too hot before, and using this stand has stopped the shutting down without warning!....Believe in this product so much so, that when I purchased a second laptop (for another family member) I also purchased another one of these stands! They are comfortable to use on your lap, or at a table. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Buettner

customer_reviews.title: It’s so good, Bought another!
customer_reviews.text: It’s lightweight but also strong. Easy portable. I got one for my computer. Then others in the household would borrow occasionally and then it just made sense to get a second one. If I had a third laptop, I’d definitely get a third stand. It’s definitely worth the price. Love that it is foldable, so it can go in the laptop bag along w the laptop. It also comes with a cord organizer, comes in handy. Can’t say enough... get it!
customer_reviews.author: JustMe1

customer_reviews.title: comfort lacking
customer_reviews.text: I am debating whether or not to keep this stand. I love everything about it except for the two pieces of metal that hold the computer on the stand and keep it from sliding off. I have modified it with cardboard as other reviewers have suggested. However, it bugs me that the design is so flawed and I had to do a modification to a new product. I don't know anyone with such a thick laptop that they wouldn't need something to lift up.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: Useful product with a minor inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ventilated adjustable laptop stand because I was having a bit of trouble reaching my laptops keyboard which was a bit of inconvenience. I found the stand to be sturdy but yet light and very well built. I also like the cord organizer which really helps. Unfortunately, the stand itself came a little bent at the front-left corner when I got mine. My 15" laptop hangs off the sides a little bit which wouldn't be a problem except I now need a stand for my external cooling air vacuum. My only wish is for AmazonBasics to have different sizes of this stand for different-sized laptops. Other than all this, this stand is a fair product.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Houston

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty...basic
customer_reviews.text: Well, as others have mentioned, it's a wrist-catcher. Yes, you can put a spacer under the laptop but to bring the laptop up high enough so as to not catch your wrists on the holding tabs, it will be 1.5"'s off the desktop. That's a bit tall epending on how you sit. You can get it to work but another 2 minutes of engineering time would have made this a great product. Insted it's just acceptable. I'll probably dedicate some time with a dremmel, polisher and a bit of black paint correcting the issues. Also, the expanded metal is a bit deformed. I had to spend some time trying to reshape it to be proper.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: The materials are not super high quality here but for the price it is awesome. It's cheap to the feel but holds my 15" Razer Blade laptop up to allow better thermals while gaming. I wouldn't recommend any of these stands to anyone unless you plan on using a second screen. The angle of the keyboard would not be comfortable in the slightest if you intended to use your laptop on this stand. So 2nd screen, keyboard and mouse, and this is a great solution!
customer_reviews.author: Daremo

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend this Laptop Stand
customer_reviews.text: After looking at a lot of products to tilt my 16'' HP laptop, finally settled on this one. Wasn't disappointed - it's near perfect! Very light weight, keeps my laptop cool all day, lots of angle adjustments. Fits my particular laptop beautifully although I did follow the advice of a previous buyer to put the cardboard strips (that come with the packaging) at the front of the stand to slightly raise the laptop to be level with the stands two front tabs. This did make it much more comfortable to rest my hands on the laptop
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to type due to the clips that hold the laptop
customer_reviews.text: Laptop is held at the right angle, but the clips that hold it on stick way up over the laptop. They dig into your wrists as you try to type. It would be even worse if our laptop were newer and therefore thinner!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen, MomX3

customer_reviews.title: Your Computer Will Thank You. Looks Nice Too.
customer_reviews.text: It's great! My laptop was getting too hot sitting flat, and this fix make better. It has quite a few settings to adjust the angle but I found that it's just perfect angle-wise with the unit closed. The rubber duflochey that comes with it goes on the back and fits snugly in a similarly shaped slot and holds your wires - a nice touch. I know you could figure it out, but this eliminates the 12-14 seconds you'd otherwise spend saying hmmm, I wonder what this doodad is for. This was a good value, it looks great, does what it's supposed to, and has certainly earned two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Kate O'Kieffe

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop stand for several reasons. Foremost was to give air circulation under the laptop. Previous to the purchase of the stand, I had the laptop just sitting on 2 small pieces of wood to permit circulation but this does a far better job. It also elevates the screen of the laptop so that it's more at eye level and actually provides a few more inches of space on the top of my computer station. If you buy this, you must realize immediately that you'll need to have an external keyboard for your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: G. Furlong

customer_reviews.title: No More Neck Pains!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, doesn’t take too much room, and my 13” laptop fits perfectly on it! It gives the right angle to elevate my laptop next to my second bigger screen. I wish the metal pieces that hold the bottom of laptop had a protective cushion on them because they hurt and it makes it hard to use my computer keyboard. I now use a separate keyboard connected via usb to avoid using my computer keyboard and touching the sharp metal laptop stand.
customer_reviews.author: @TheSurfingExpert

customer_reviews.title: Only good for thick PC's or if used with external keyboard, monitor and mouse.
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to use a laptop on a desk with external monitor, keyboard and mouse - the Amazon Basics stand is an OK option. If you are looking for a stand that allows you adjust your Macbook or MacBook Pro at a comfortable angle for viewing/typing - forget it. It's horrible. The large securing areas at the bottom of the adjustable tray are much higher than the flat surface of a MacBook Pro, Air or Macbook. It's uncomfortable to use to the point of being worthless. If you have older or "thick" PC chassis it may be fine. Would have returned it if able.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olin

customer_reviews.title: Purchased specifically for Ableton Push 2
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I ordered this specifically for my Ableton Push 2 controller. I’m very pleased with this stand for use with the Push. The Push is large and heavy but the stand handles the weight, freeing up desk space and holds up well to the physical forces exerted on the pads and buttons of the Push. Having the Push elevated seems to make the screen easier to see as well.
customer_reviews.author: MSM

customer_reviews.title: Like a tiny, heavy cage you will despise
customer_reviews.text: The worst object I have ever used. Extremely heavy, cumbersome and noisily clatters open in a quiet library. It’s like someone took a metal shopping cart or a literal cage for a wild animal and sliced off a section for customers to knock their hands and elbows on its sharp, ugly corners. Use a large volume, such as the DSM-V or collected Proust instead.
customer_reviews.author: persephonebooks

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: It's given me much better ventilation on the laptops that I use - they are running cooler and the angle makes the screen more visible. It also holds the laptop at an angle that make video conferencing work really well - super easy to see the screen and be seen by the camera while sitting at work! I bought one and a week later bought two more, I hadn't thought that I would do that but they have definitely solved problems that I had just seen as inconveniences in my work area - everything is much easier now,
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Cramp

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Even With Feet On Your Laptop It Scratches Your Computer
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a brand new 2 in 1 which has tiny raised feet on the bottom of the lap top, but it ended up putting several slice marks because the wire mesh is uneven. Even when you add another layer of little stick-on feet to the ones which came on it I had more scratches. It is disheartening when your new computer looks old from using this thing. It does allow it to cool so once it got the slice marks whats to lose using the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Lass

customer_reviews.title: Great for tablet mode
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a laptop that I mainly utilize in tablet mode during class to write on. It works great for this purpose. I can adjust it to many different levels to fit my need and I've never had a problem with it slipping out of place. I've been using this almost every day for about 2 years and it still looks new. It's really light weight and easy to transport, but can be a little bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's cool :)
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty cool. It keeps my laptop ventilated and it's adjustable and lightweight. The gripe I have is the pieces that hold the laptop in place, is not comfortable at all! I use a wireless keyboard and mouse, so that protects my wrists but otherwise it would hurt your wrists. I would advise getting something to cover those two pieces if you're using your laptop keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: ChaNija

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: VERY heavy laptop monitor stand--weighs a ton!--while really doesn't provide good ergonomic angle for using keyboard for all the heft and weight. Also, unless you have a laptop which opens fully (180 degrees), this several "adjustments" still don't do much good in terms of providing a good viewing angle, at least for a relatively tall person. On top of that, this is a finger-pinching contraption--and it hurts* when it bites!
customer_reviews.author: Biblio
